intro: Murdannia stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf murdannia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as the spiderwort family. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual or perennial, characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with three petals and three sepals, and are arranged in clusters. Murdannia stricta is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands.
